title: Ticket #4469: Clarify/correct information in DAGMan node status file
description:
When I was working on fixing a bug in the node status file (#4312) I noticed a couple of things that we may want to change:

  1. If a DAG is aborted, but the abort-dag-on return value is 0, the DAG status shows up as '5; "STATUS_DONE (success)"', which is the same as if the DAG completes normally. I'm wondering whether it should be something like '5; "STATUS_DONE (aborted_success)"', or maybe if there should be a separate aborted attribute in the ClassAd.

  2. If you have a final node, and your DAG is aborted (with a non-zero abort return value), the status of the DAG before the final node is run is '6; "STATUS_ERROR (aborted)"' -- I wonder if it should still be '3; "STATUS_SUBMITTED ()"'.

(Note: comment delimiters removed above because they goofed up formatting.)

(There may be other things we should look at, too -- these are just the ones I've thought of so far.)
remarks:

Here's another:

  • If the DAG is halted and all node jobs drain from the queue (and DAGMan therefore exits) should the final status be "STATUS_ERROR (halted)" instead of "STATUS_ERROR (failed)"?
